body.raw:
# Lululemon thesis
Since its peak in late 2023, Lululemon stock has dropped by over 50%.
I tend to think sudden violent drops due to earnings are short-lived, as seen by previous price action in the stock.

Earnings performance since ATH:
- period ending Jan '24: 3.19b; 0.38% revenue beat
- period ending Apr '24: 2.20b; 0.40% revenue beat
- period ending Jul '24: 2.41b; 1.46% revenue miss
- period ending Oct '24: ????b; ?.??% revenue ????

YoY the earnings performance doesn't look bad. So why did Lululemon drop so much from its peak, and what can we learn about a recovery using comparable scenarios?

## NKE stock
- down from its peak in Nov 2021
- revenues have decreased YoY, unlike lulu
- dividends have also bogged down its price
- recovered losses before more investor 

the two stocks are not completely correlated, they each have different highs, dividend history (lulu has none), and size (lulu has ~1/6th the quarterly revenue)

The pattern I see here is that
